title: When you help your teammate out with advice and encouragement instead of flaming them like Tyler1

replies.body: everyone should take this advice. be nice to your team. help them out, give them positive encouragement, if there are two or more in a lane share it *looks at ADC/sup*, and  most of, all win or lose, have fun with the game. flaming, crying, inting, and straight up being a dick will not help you in games. period. if someone is making a bad play, is harassing you with ping spams, and overall grieving and trying to surrender the best thing to do is leave them be. with everyone having a mindset of "being an asshole works so why should i stop?" nothing will get through to them and they will not listen to your kind words and helpful advice. just report them post game and move on.

All my losses I have are due to negative/toxic teammates. When my team says nothing or nothing negative, we win and/or make a com back.
The one time I did this the dude still took it as flaming and inted. Doesn't matter what rank you are, Yasuo players never seem to leave bronze and silver behind.
